item.title: Not Enough Room for E Bikes, 4th September
item.description:
With the current road works being undertaken there is little room to move along hte pavement, particularily for persons using wheelchairs or if Channel 4 evacuates. Please could the bays be suspended until the works are completed?

item.title: Vehicle abandoned since June and MOT expired, 4th September
item.description:
Vehicle has been abandoned since June. Previously reported but had tax and MOT. MOT now expired. Broken window on vehicle and people have been filling the back with rubbish. It is taxed until April but surely cannot be left until then. It has not moved from this parking bay.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Works due to start yesterday, 4th September
item.description:
There are 3 way traffic lights just before our house at 127 Hamilton Terrace and an area closed off for road works but no works being carried out. What is happening the traffic is really bad because there is school in Marlborough place and in the morning and afternoon the traffic is chaotic. Please advise what is going on Thank you Marion Goulden Flat B
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Hamilton Terrace, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melford Road, Dulwich, London

item.title: Cycle way on pavement is unclear, 4th September
item.description:
The painted white cycle signs between the white line and the pavement edge have worn away. Very hazardous for pedestrians because they are unaware that this cycle way exists on the pavement so when walking south east they often step in front of cyclists coming from behind who are also going south east.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pierrepont Row, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car Park charge incorrect on sign, 4th September
item.description:
The charge for 4 hours if paid cashless as advertised on the car park signage is stated to be £3.90 + 20p convenience charge whereas RingGo charges £4.30.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued problem of people dumping rubbish in one particular area, 4th September
item.description:
We have rats in our gardens that back on to West Lodge in Russell Close and this has been confirmed by several of the neighbours. People are continuing to dump rubbish in this area including the verge on Arnsberg Way despite bushes being cut back. The owner has no interest in removing this rubbish despite there being empty skips on the land and is not very forthcoming or accommodating. The rubbish contains by the look of it clothing as well as a mattress to the rear of one property. This really is unsatisfactory and is a problem that we have had to put up with for far too long. A lot of the residents in Russell Close have young children that play in the gardens, which causes a health and safety issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Russell Close, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
